meanings.definition: To increase in intensity or severity.
meanings.sent1: When the argument started to get louder, it reescalated quickly.
meanings.sent2: The tension between the two friends reescalates every time they discuss politics.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show took an unexpected turn when the laughter reescalated to uproarious levels.
meanings.sent4: The storm reescalated, unleashing its fury on the small town.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room reescalated as the surprise guest was revealed.

meanings.definition: To cause to increase in intensity or severity.
meanings.sent1: His harsh words reescalated the already tense situation.
meanings.sent2: The new policy reescalates the challenges faced by small businesses.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten reescalated the calm by knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's reescalating tone finally caught the attention of the chatty students.
meanings.sent5: The chef's addition of extra spices reescalated the flavors of the dish.
